books.name: Genesis
books.description: The book of beginnings - creation, fall, flood, and the patriarchs
books.author: Moses

chaptersContent.title: The Creation of the World
chaptersContent.summary: God creates the heavens and the earth in six days and rests on the seventh
chaptersContent.content: In the beginning God created the heavens and the earth. The earth was without form and void, and darkness was over the face of the deep. And the Spirit of God was hovering over the face of the waters. And God said, 'Let there be light,' and there was light.

chaptersContent.title: The Garden of Eden
chaptersContent.summary: God forms man from dust, creates the Garden of Eden, and makes woman
chaptersContent.content: Then the Lord God formed the man of dust from the ground and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life, and the man became a living creature. And the Lord God planted a garden in Eden, in the east, and there he put the man whom he had formed.

chaptersContent.title: The Fall
chaptersContent.summary: Adam and Eve disobey God, sin enters the world, and they are expelled from Eden
chaptersContent.content: So when the woman saw that the tree was good for food, and that it was a delight to the eyes, and that the tree was to be desired to make one wise, she took of its fruit and ate, and she also gave some to her husband who was with her, and he ate.

chaptersContent.title: Cain and Abel
chaptersContent.summary: The first murder occurs when Cain kills his brother Abel out of jealousy
chaptersContent.content: And Abel also brought of the firstborn of his flock and of their fat portions. And the Lord had regard for Abel and his offering, but for Cain and his offering he had no regard.

chaptersContent.title: Noah and the Flood
chaptersContent.summary: God calls Noah to build an ark to save humanity and animals from the flood
chaptersContent.content: But Noah found favor in the eyes of the Lord. These are the generations of Noah. Noah was a righteous man, blameless in his generation. Noah walked with God.

chaptersContent.title: The Call of Abraham
chaptersContent.summary: God calls Abram to leave his country and promises to make him a great nation
chaptersContent.content: Now the Lord said to Abram, 'Go from your country and your kindred and your father's house to the land that I will show you. And I will make of you a great nation, and I will bless you and make your name great, so that you will be a blessing.'

chaptersContent.title: The Sacrifice of Isaac
chaptersContent.summary: God tests Abraham's faith by asking him to sacrifice his son Isaac
chaptersContent.content: He said, 'Take your son, your only son Isaac, whom you love, and go to the land of Moriah, and offer him there as a burnt offering on one of the mountains of which I shall tell you.'

books.name: Exodus
books.description: The deliverance of Israel from Egypt and the giving of the Law
books.author: Moses

chaptersContent.title: Israel's Suffering in Egypt
chaptersContent.summary: The Israelites multiply in Egypt but are oppressed by a new pharaoh
chaptersContent.content: But the people of Israel were fruitful and increased greatly; they multiplied and grew exceedingly strong, so that the land was filled with them. Now there arose a new king over Egypt, who did not know Joseph.

chaptersContent.title: The Burning Bush
chaptersContent.summary: God appears to Moses in a burning bush and commissions him to deliver Israel
chaptersContent.content: And the angel of the Lord appeared to him in a flame of fire out of the midst of a bush. He looked, and behold, the bush was burning, yet it was not consumed. And Moses said, 'I will turn aside to see this great sight, why the bush is not burned.'

chaptersContent.title: The Passover
chaptersContent.summary: God institutes the Passover and delivers Israel from Egypt
chaptersContent.content: The blood shall be a sign for you, on the houses where you are. And when I see the blood, I will pass over you, and no plague will befall you to destroy you, when I strike the land of Egypt.

chaptersContent.title: Crossing the Red Sea
chaptersContent.summary: God parts the Red Sea for Israel to escape and destroys Pharaoh's army
chaptersContent.content: And Moses said to the people, 'Fear not, stand firm, and see the salvation of the Lord, which he will work for you today. For the Egyptians whom you see today, you shall never see again.'

chaptersContent.title: The Ten Commandments
chaptersContent.summary: God gives the Ten Commandments to Israel at Mount Sinai
chaptersContent.content: And God spoke all these words, saying, 'I am the Lord your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery. You shall have no other gods before me.'

books.name: Leviticus
books.description: Laws and rituals for worship, holiness, and priestly duties
books.author: Moses

chaptersContent.title: The Day of Atonement
chaptersContent.summary: God establishes the annual Day of Atonement for Israel's sins
chaptersContent.content: For on this day shall atonement be made for you to cleanse you. You shall be clean before the Lord from all your sins. It is a Sabbath of solemn rest to you, and you shall afflict yourselves; it is a statute forever.

chaptersContent.title: Laws of Holiness
chaptersContent.summary: God calls Israel to be holy and gives laws for righteous living
chaptersContent.content: Speak to all the congregation of the people of Israel and say to them: You shall be holy, for I the Lord your God am holy. You shall not hate your brother in your heart, but you shall reason frankly with your neighbor, lest you incur sin because of him.

books.name: Numbers
books.description: Israel's wilderness wanderings and preparations to enter the Promised Land
books.author: Moses

chaptersContent.title: The Twelve Spies
chaptersContent.summary: Twelve spies explore the Promised Land, but only two trust God
chaptersContent.content: But Caleb quieted the people before Moses and said, 'Let us go up at once and occupy it, for we are well able to overcome it.' Then the men who had gone up with him said, 'We are not able to go up against the people, for they are stronger than we are.'

chaptersContent.title: Israel's Rebellion
chaptersContent.summary: Israel rebels against God and is sentenced to wander 40 years
chaptersContent.content: And the Lord said to Moses, 'How long will this people despise me? And how long will they not believe in me, in spite of all the signs that I have done among them?'

books.name: Deuteronomy
books.description: Moses' final speeches reviewing the law and preparing Israel for the Promised Land
books.author: Moses

chaptersContent.title: The Great Commandment
chaptersContent.summary: Moses declares the greatest commandment to love God with all your heart
chaptersContent.content: Hear, O Israel: The Lord our God, the Lord is one. You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your might. And these words that I command you today shall be on your heart.

chaptersContent.title: Choose Life
chaptersContent.summary: Moses presents the choice between life and death, blessing and curse
chaptersContent.content: I call heaven and earth to witness against you today, that I have set before you life and death, blessing and curse. Therefore choose life, that you and your offspring may live, loving the Lord your God, obeying his voice and holding fast to him.

books.name: Psalms
books.description: Songs and prayers expressing worship, praise, and petition
books.author: David and others

chaptersContent.title: The Way of the Righteous and the Wicked
chaptersContent.summary: Contrasts the blessed life of the righteous with the fate of the wicked
chaptersContent.content: Blessed is the man who walks not in the counsel of the wicked, nor stands in the way of sinners, nor sits in the seat of scoffers, but his delight is in the law of the Lord, and on his law he meditates day and night.

chaptersContent.title: The Lord is My Shepherd
chaptersContent.summary: David's famous psalm about God's care and guidance
chaptersContent.content: The Lord is my shepherd; I shall not want. He makes me lie down in green pastures. He leads me beside still waters. He restores my soul. He leads me in paths of righteousness for his name's sake.

chaptersContent.title: A Prayer for Forgiveness
chaptersContent.summary: David's prayer of repentance after his sin with Bathsheba
chaptersContent.content: Have mercy on me, O God, according to your steadfast love; according to your abundant mercy blot out my transgressions. Wash me thoroughly from my iniquity, and cleanse me from my sin!

chaptersContent.title: The Glory of God's Word
chaptersContent.summary: The longest chapter in the Bible celebrating God's Word and law
chaptersContent.content: How can a young man keep his way pure? By guarding it according to your word. I have stored up your word in my heart, that I might not sin against you.

books.name: Proverbs
books.description: Wisdom literature providing practical guidance for righteous living
books.author: Solomon and others

chaptersContent.title: The Purpose of Proverbs
chaptersContent.summary: Introduction to the purpose and value of wisdom and instruction
chaptersContent.content: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of knowledge; fools despise wisdom and instruction. To receive instruction in wise dealing, in righteousness, justice, and equity.

chaptersContent.title: Trust in the Lord
chaptersContent.summary: Wisdom about trusting God and the benefits of following His ways
chaptersContent.content: Trust in the Lord with all your heart, and do not lean on your own understanding. In all your ways acknowledge him, and he will make straight your paths.

chaptersContent.title: The Virtuous Woman
chaptersContent.summary: Description of a woman of noble character and her qualities
chaptersContent.content: An excellent wife who can find? She is far more precious than jewels. The heart of her husband trusts in her, and he will have no lack of gain.

books.name: Ecclesiastes
books.description: Solomon's reflections on the meaning and purpose of life
books.author: Solomon

chaptersContent.title: A Time for Everything
chaptersContent.summary: Famous passage about times and seasons in life
chaptersContent.content: For everything there is a season, and a time for every matter under heaven: a time to be born, and a time to die; a time to plant, and a time to pluck up what is planted.

chaptersContent.title: Remember Your Creator
chaptersContent.summary: The conclusion: fear God and keep His commandments
chaptersContent.content: Remember also your Creator in the days of your youth, before the evil days come and the years draw near of which you will say, 'I have no pleasure in them.'

books.name: Isaiah
books.description: Prophecies of judgment and salvation, including Messianic prophecies
books.author: Isaiah

chaptersContent.title: The Sign of Immanuel
chaptersContent.summary: Prophecy of the virgin birth and Immanuel
chaptersContent.content: Therefore the Lord himself will give you a sign. Behold, the virgin shall conceive and bear a son, and shall call his name Immanuel.

chaptersContent.title: The Suffering Servant
chaptersContent.summary: Prophecy of the Messiah's suffering for our sins
chaptersContent.content: But he was pierced for our transgressions; he was crushed for our iniquities; upon him was the chastisement that brought us peace, and with his wounds we are healed.

books.name: Matthew
books.description: The Gospel presenting Jesus as the promised Messiah and King
books.author: Matthew

chaptersContent.title: The Genealogy and Birth of Jesus
chaptersContent.summary: Matthew traces Jesus' lineage and recounts His virgin birth
chaptersContent.content: The book of the genealogy of Jesus Christ, the son of David, the son of Abraham. She will bear a son, and you shall call his name Jesus, for he will save his people from their sins.

chaptersContent.title: The Sermon on the Mount - Beatitudes
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus teaches the Beatitudes and principles of kingdom living
chaptersContent.content: Seeing the crowds, he went up on the mountain, and when he sat down, his disciples came to him. And he opened his mouth and taught them, saying: 'Blessed are the poor in spirit, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.'

chaptersContent.title: Peter's Confession
chaptersContent.summary: Peter declares Jesus as the Christ, the Son of the living God
chaptersContent.content: Simon Peter replied, 'You are the Christ, the Son of the living God.' And Jesus answered him, 'Blessed are you, Simon Bar-Jonah! For flesh and blood has not revealed this to you, but my Father who is in heaven.'

chaptersContent.title: The Resurrection and Great Commission
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus rises from the dead and commissions His disciples
chaptersContent.content: He is not here, for he has risen, as he said. Come, see the place where he lay. Go therefore and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit.

books.name: Mark
books.description: The Gospel emphasizing Jesus as the suffering Servant
books.author: Mark

chaptersContent.title: The Beginning of the Gospel
chaptersContent.summary: John the Baptist prepares the way; Jesus is baptized and begins ministry
chaptersContent.content: The beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ, the Son of God. And a voice came from heaven, 'You are my beloved Son; with you I am well pleased.'

chaptersContent.title: Peter's Confession and the Cross
chaptersContent.summary: Peter confesses Jesus as Christ; Jesus predicts His death
chaptersContent.content: And he asked them, 'But who do you say that I am?' Peter answered him, 'You are the Christ.' And calling the crowd to him with his disciples, he said to them, 'If anyone would come after me, let him deny himself and take up his cross and follow me.'

books.name: Luke
books.description: The Gospel emphasizing Jesus' humanity and compassion for all people
books.author: Luke

chaptersContent.title: The Birth of John and Jesus Foretold
chaptersContent.summary: Angel Gabriel announces the births of John the Baptist and Jesus
chaptersContent.content: And the angel answered her, 'The Holy Spirit will come upon you, and the power of the Most High will overshadow you; therefore the child to be born will be called holy—the Son of God.'

chaptersContent.title: The Lost Sheep, Coin, and Son
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus tells three parables about God's joy over the repentant
chaptersContent.content: Just so, I tell you, there will be more joy in heaven over one sinner who repents than over ninety-nine righteous persons who need no repentance.

books.name: John
books.description: The Gospel emphasizing Jesus as the Son of God and eternal life
books.author: John

chaptersContent.title: The Word Became Flesh
chaptersContent.summary: John introduces Jesus as the eternal Word who became flesh
chaptersContent.content: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God. And the Word became flesh and dwelt among us, and we have seen his glory, glory as of the only Son from the Father, full of grace and truth.

chaptersContent.title: Jesus and Nicodemus
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus teaches about being born again and God's love for the world
chaptersContent.content: Jesus answered him, 'Truly, truly, I say to you, unless one is born again he cannot see the kingdom of God.' For God so loved the world, that he gave his only Son, that whoever believes in him should not perish but have eternal life.

chaptersContent.title: Jesus the Way, Truth, and Life
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus comforts His disciples and promises the Holy Spirit
chaptersContent.content: Jesus said to him, 'I am the way, and the truth, and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me. And I will ask the Father, and he will give you another Helper, to be with you forever.'

books.name: Acts
books.description: The history of the early church and the spread of the Gospel
books.author: Luke

chaptersContent.title: The Ascension and Promise of the Spirit
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus ascends to heaven and promises the Holy Spirit
chaptersContent.content: But you will receive power when the Holy Spirit has come upon you, and you will be my witnesses in Jerusalem and in all Judea and Samaria, and to the end of the earth.

chaptersContent.title: Pentecost
chaptersContent.summary: The Holy Spirit comes upon the disciples at Pentecost
chaptersContent.content: And they were all filled with the Holy Spirit and began to speak in other tongues as the Spirit gave them utterance. And Peter said to them, 'Repent and be baptized every one of you in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of your sins, and you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.'

books.name: Romans
books.description: Paul's systematic presentation of the Gospel and righteousness
books.author: Paul

chaptersContent.title: Paul's Gospel and Human Sinfulness
chaptersContent.summary: Paul introduces his gospel and describes universal human sinfulness
chaptersContent.content: For I am not ashamed of the gospel, for it is the power of God for salvation to everyone who believes, to the Jew first and also to the Greek. For in it the righteousness of God is revealed from faith for faith, as it is written, 'The righteous shall live by faith.'

chaptersContent.title: Righteousness Through Faith
chaptersContent.summary: Paul explains justification by faith apart from works
chaptersContent.content: For all have sinned and fall short of the glory of God, and are justified by his grace as a gift, through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus. For we hold that one is justified by faith apart from works of the law.

chaptersContent.title: Life in the Spirit
chaptersContent.summary: Paul describes the victory believers have through the Spirit
chaptersContent.content: There is therefore now no condemnation for those who are in Christ Jesus. For the law of the Spirit of life has set you free in Christ Jesus from the law of sin and death. And we know that for those who love God all things work together for good, for those who are called according to his purpose.

books.name: 1 Corinthians
books.description: Paul's letter addressing problems in the Corinthian church
books.author: Paul

chaptersContent.title: The Way of Love
chaptersContent.summary: Paul's famous chapter on love being the greatest virtue
chaptersContent.content: Love is patient and kind; love does not envy or boast; it is not arrogant or rude. It does not insist on its own way; it is not irritable or resentful. Love never ends. So now faith, hope, and love abide, these three; but the greatest of these is love.

chaptersContent.title: The Resurrection
chaptersContent.summary: Paul defends the reality and importance of Christ's resurrection
chaptersContent.content: For I delivered to you as of first importance what I also received: that Christ died for our sins in accordance with the Scriptures, that he was buried, that he was raised on the third day in accordance with the Scriptures.

books.name: Ephesians
books.description: Paul's letter about the church as the body of Christ and Christian living
books.author: Paul

chaptersContent.title: Saved by Grace
chaptersContent.summary: Paul explains salvation by grace through faith, not works
chaptersContent.content: For by grace you have been saved through faith. And this is not your own doing; it is the gift of God, not a result of works, so that no one may boast. For we are his workmanship, created in Christ Jesus for good works, which God prepared beforehand, that we should walk in them.

chaptersContent.title: The Armor of God
chaptersContent.summary: Paul describes the spiritual armor believers need for spiritual warfare
chaptersContent.content: Put on the whole armor of God, that you may be able to stand against the schemes of the devil. Therefore take up the whole armor of God, that you may be able to withstand in the evil day, and having done all, to stand firm.

books.name: Philippians
books.description: Paul's joyful letter about contentment and joy in Christ
books.author: Paul

chaptersContent.title: The Mind of Christ
chaptersContent.summary: Paul exhorts to humility using Christ's example of incarnation
chaptersContent.content: Have this mind among yourselves, which is yours in Christ Jesus, who, though he was in the form of God, did not count equality with God a thing to be grasped, but emptied himself, by taking the form of a servant, being born in the likeness of men.

chaptersContent.title: Rejoice in the Lord
chaptersContent.summary: Paul's instructions on joy, peace, and contentment in all circumstances
chaptersContent.content: Rejoice in the Lord always; again I will say, rejoice. I can do all things through him who strengthens me. And my God will supply every need of yours according to his riches in glory in Christ Jesus.

books.name: Revelation
books.description: John's apocalyptic vision of the end times and Christ's return
books.author: John

chaptersContent.title: The Revelation of Jesus Christ
chaptersContent.summary: John introduces his vision of the glorified Christ
chaptersContent.content: The revelation of Jesus Christ, which God gave him to show to his servants the things that must soon take place. 'I am the Alpha and the Omega,' says the Lord God, 'who is and who was and who is to come, the Almighty.'

chaptersContent.title: The New Heaven and New Earth
chaptersContent.summary: God creates a new heaven and earth; the New Jerusalem descends
chaptersContent.content: Then I saw a new heaven and a new earth, for the first heaven and the first earth had passed away, and the sea was no more. And he who was seated on the throne said, 'Behold, I am making all things new.'

books.name: Ruth
books.description: The story of Ruth's loyalty and God's providence
books.author: Unknown

chaptersContent.title: Ruth's Loyalty to Naomi
chaptersContent.summary: Ruth chooses to stay with Naomi after her husband's death
chaptersContent.content: But Ruth said, 'Do not urge me to leave you or to return from following you. For where you go I will go, and where you lodge I will lodge. Your people shall be my people, and your God my God.'

chaptersContent.title: Ruth Meets Boaz
chaptersContent.summary: Ruth gleans in Boaz's field and finds favor with him
chaptersContent.content: But Boaz answered her, 'All that you have done for your mother-in-law since the death of your husband has been fully told to me, and how you left your father and mother and your native land and came to a people that you did not know before.'

chaptersContent.title: Ruth's Request to Boaz
chaptersContent.summary: Ruth asks Boaz to be her kinsman-redeemer
chaptersContent.content: He said, 'Who are you?' And she answered, 'I am Ruth, your servant. Spread your wings over your servant, for you are a redeemer.'

chaptersContent.title: Boaz Redeems Ruth
chaptersContent.summary: Boaz marries Ruth and they become ancestors of David
chaptersContent.content: So Boaz took Ruth, and she became his wife. And he went in to her, and the Lord gave her conception, and she bore a son. And they named him Obed. He was the father of Jesse, the father of David.

books.name: Joel
books.description: Prophecy about the Day of the Lord and outpouring of the Spirit
books.author: Joel

chaptersContent.title: The Locust Plague
chaptersContent.summary: Joel describes a devastating locust plague as a sign of judgment
chaptersContent.content: What the cutting locust left, the swarming locust has eaten. What the swarming locust left, the hopping locust has eaten, and what the hopping locust left, the destroying locust has eaten.

chaptersContent.title: The Day of the Lord and Promise of the Spirit
chaptersContent.summary: Joel prophesies about the Day of the Lord and God's Spirit being poured out
chaptersContent.content: And it shall come to pass afterward, that I will pour out my Spirit on all flesh; your sons and your daughters shall prophesy, your old men shall dream dreams, and your young men shall see visions.

chaptersContent.title: Judgment of the Nations
chaptersContent.summary: God promises to judge the nations and restore Israel
chaptersContent.content: I will gather all the nations and bring them down to the Valley of Jehoshaphat. And I will enter into judgment with them there, on behalf of my people and my heritage Israel.

books.name: Obadiah
books.description: Prophecy of judgment against Edom for their pride and violence
books.author: Obadiah

chaptersContent.title: Judgment on Edom
chaptersContent.summary: God pronounces judgment on Edom for their pride and violence against Israel
chaptersContent.content: The pride of your heart has deceived you, you who live in the clefts of the rock, in your lofty dwelling, who say in your heart, 'Who will bring me down to the ground?' For the day of the Lord is near upon all the nations. As you have done, it shall be done to you; your deeds shall return on your own head.

books.name: Jonah
books.description: The story of Jonah's mission to Nineveh and God's mercy
books.author: Unknown

chaptersContent.title: Jonah Flees from God
chaptersContent.summary: Jonah tries to flee from God's command to go to Nineveh
chaptersContent.content: Now the word of the Lord came to Jonah the son of Amittai, saying, 'Arise, go to Nineveh, that great city, and call out against it, for their evil has come up before me.' But Jonah rose to flee to Tarshish from the presence of the Lord.

chaptersContent.title: Jonah's Prayer
chaptersContent.summary: From the belly of the fish, Jonah prays and is delivered
chaptersContent.content: Then Jonah prayed to the Lord his God from the belly of the fish, saying, 'I called out to the Lord, out of my distress, and he answered me; out of the belly of Sheol I cried, and you heard my voice.'

chaptersContent.title: Nineveh Repents
chaptersContent.summary: Jonah preaches to Nineveh and the entire city repents
chaptersContent.content: And the people of Nineveh believed God. They called for a fast and put on sackcloth, from the greatest of them to the least of them. When God saw what they did, how they turned from their evil way, God relented of the disaster that he had said he would do to them, and he did not do it.

chaptersContent.title: Jonah's Anger and God's Compassion
chaptersContent.summary: Jonah is angry at God's mercy, but God teaches him about compassion
chaptersContent.content: And he prayed to the Lord and said, 'O Lord, is not this what I said when I was yet in my country? That is why I made haste to flee to Tarshish; for I knew that you are a gracious God and merciful, slow to anger and abounding in steadfast love, and relenting from disaster.'

books.name: Haggai
books.description: Prophecy encouraging the rebuilding of the temple after exile
books.author: Haggai

chaptersContent.title: Call to Rebuild the Temple
chaptersContent.summary: Haggai challenges the people to prioritize rebuilding God's temple
chaptersContent.content: Is it a time for you yourselves to dwell in your paneled houses, while this house lies in ruins? Now, therefore, thus says the Lord of hosts: Consider your ways. You have sown much, and harvested little.

chaptersContent.title: The Glory of the New Temple
chaptersContent.summary: God promises that the new temple's glory will exceed the former
chaptersContent.content: Yet now be strong, O Zerubbabel, declares the Lord. Be strong, O Joshua, son of Jehozadak, the high priest. Be strong, all you people of the land, declares the Lord. Work, for I am with you, declares the Lord of hosts.

books.name: Philemon
books.description: Paul's personal letter about forgiveness and reconciliation
books.author: Paul

chaptersContent.title: A Plea for Onesimus
chaptersContent.summary: Paul appeals to Philemon to forgive and receive back his runaway slave Onesimus
chaptersContent.content: I appeal to you for my child, Onesimus, whose father I became in my imprisonment. No longer as a bondservant but more than a bondservant, as a beloved brother—especially to me, but how much more to you, both in the flesh and in the Lord.

books.name: 2 John
books.description: John's letter about truth and love in Christian fellowship
books.author: John

chaptersContent.title: Walking in Truth and Love
chaptersContent.summary: John emphasizes the importance of truth and love, warning against false teachers
chaptersContent.content: I rejoiced greatly to find some of your children walking in the truth, just as we were commanded by the Father. And this is love, that we walk according to his commandments; this is the commandment, just as you have heard from the beginning, so that you should walk in it.

books.name: 3 John
books.description: John's letter about hospitality and church leadership
books.author: John

chaptersContent.title: Gaius's Hospitality
chaptersContent.summary: John commends Gaius for his hospitality and warns against Diotrephes
chaptersContent.content: I have no greater joy than to hear that my children are walking in the truth. Beloved, do not imitate evil but imitate good. Whoever does good is from God; whoever does evil has not seen God.

books.name: Jude
books.description: Jude's urgent letter about contending for the faith
books.author: Jude

chaptersContent.title: Contend for the Faith
chaptersContent.summary: Jude urges believers to contend for the faith against false teachers
chaptersContent.content: Beloved, although I was very eager to write to you about our common salvation, I found it necessary to write appealing to you to contend for the faith that was once for all delivered to the saints. Now to him who is able to keep you from stumbling and to present you blameless before the presence of his glory with great joy.

books.name: 2 Corinthians
books.description: Paul's defense of his apostolic ministry and call to Christian living
books.author: Paul

chaptersContent.title: Treasure in Jars of Clay
chaptersContent.summary: Paul describes the ministry as treasure in earthen vessels
chaptersContent.content: But we have this treasure in jars of clay, to show that the surpassing power belongs to God and not to us. So we do not lose heart. Though our outer self is wasting away, our inner self is being renewed day by day.

chaptersContent.title: New Creation and Reconciliation
chaptersContent.summary: Paul teaches about the new creation and ministry of reconciliation
chaptersContent.content: Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, he is a new creation. The old has passed away; behold, the new has come. All this is from God, who reconciled us to himself through Christ and gave us the ministry of reconciliation.

chaptersContent.title: Paul's Thorn in the Flesh
chaptersContent.summary: Paul shares about his weakness and God's sufficient grace
chaptersContent.content: So to keep me from becoming conceited because of the surpassing greatness of the revelations, a thorn was given me in the flesh, a messenger of Satan to harass me, to keep me from becoming conceited. But he said to me, 'My grace is sufficient for you, for my power is made perfect in weakness.'

books.name: Galatians
books.description: Paul's passionate defense of salvation by grace through faith
books.author: Paul

chaptersContent.title: Justified by Faith
chaptersContent.summary: Paul defends justification by faith, not by works of the law
chaptersContent.content: Yet we know that a person is not justified by works of the law but through faith in Jesus Christ, so we also have believed in Christ Jesus, in order to be justified by faith in Christ and not by works of the law, because by works of the law no one will be justified.

chaptersContent.title: Freedom and the Fruit of the Spirit
chaptersContent.summary: Paul teaches about Christian freedom and the fruit of the Spirit
chaptersContent.content: For freedom Christ has set us free; stand firm therefore, and do not submit again to a yoke of slavery. But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faithfulness, gentleness, self-control; against such things there is no law.

chaptersContent.title: Sowing and Reaping
chaptersContent.summary: Paul teaches about sowing and reaping, bearing burdens, and doing good
chaptersContent.content: Bear one another's burdens, and so fulfill the law of Christ. Do not be deceived: God is not mocked, for whatever one sows, that will he also reap. And let us not grow weary of doing good, for in due season we will reap, if we do not give up.

books.name: Hebrews
books.description: The superiority of Christ and the new covenant
books.author: Unknown

chaptersContent.title: The Supremacy of the Son
chaptersContent.summary: The Son is superior to angels and prophets
chaptersContent.content: Long ago, at many times and in many ways, God spoke to our fathers by the prophets, but in these last days he has spoken to us by his Son, whom he appointed the heir of all things, through whom also he created the world.

chaptersContent.title: The Promise of Rest
chaptersContent.summary: God's promise of rest for His people
chaptersContent.content: So then, there remains a Sabbath rest for the people of God, for whoever has entered God's rest has also rested from his works as God did from his. Let us then with confidence draw near to the throne of grace, that we may receive mercy and find grace to help in time of need.

chaptersContent.title: The Hall of Faith
chaptersContent.summary: Examples of faith from Old Testament heroes
chaptersContent.content: Now faith is the assurance of things hoped for, the conviction of things not seen. And without faith it is impossible to please him, for whoever would draw near to God must believe that he exists and that he rewards those who seek him.

chaptersContent.title: Endurance and Discipline
chaptersContent.summary: The discipline of the Lord and running the race with endurance
chaptersContent.content: Therefore, since we are surrounded by so great a cloud of witnesses, let us also lay aside every weight, and sin which clings so closely, and let us run with endurance the race that is set before us, looking to Jesus, the founder and perfecter of our faith.

books.name: James
books.description: Practical wisdom for Christian living and faith in action
books.author: James

chaptersContent.title: Trials and Temptations
chaptersContent.summary: James teaches about trials, temptations, and hearing God's word
chaptersContent.content: Count it all joy, my brothers, when you meet trials of various kinds, for you know that the testing of your faith produces steadfastness. Every good gift and every perfect gift is from above, coming down from the Father of lights.

chaptersContent.title: Faith and Works
chaptersContent.summary: True faith is demonstrated by good works
chaptersContent.content: So also faith by itself, if it does not have works, is dead. Do you want to be shown, you foolish person, that faith apart from works is useless? For as the body apart from the spirit is dead, so also faith apart from works is dead.

chaptersContent.title: Taming the Tongue
chaptersContent.summary: The power and danger of the tongue
chaptersContent.content: So also the tongue is a small member, yet it boasts of great things. How great a forest is set ablaze by such a small fire! But the wisdom from above is first pure, then peaceable, gentle, open to reason, full of mercy and good fruits.

chaptersContent.title: Prayer and Patience
chaptersContent.summary: Instructions on prayer, patience, and caring for one another
chaptersContent.content: Be patient, therefore, brothers, until the coming of the Lord. See how the farmer waits for the precious fruit of the earth, being patient about it until it receives the early and the late rains. The prayer of a righteous person has great power as it is working.

books.name: 1 Peter
books.description: Hope and encouragement for suffering Christians
books.author: Peter

chaptersContent.title: Living Hope
chaptersContent.summary: Peter describes the living hope we have through Christ's resurrection
chaptersContent.content: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ! According to his great mercy, he has caused us to be born again to a living hope through the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead, to an inheritance that is imperishable, undefiled, and unfading.

chaptersContent.title: Living Stones
chaptersContent.summary: Believers are living stones being built into a spiritual house
chaptersContent.content: You yourselves like living stones are being built up as a spiritual house, to be a holy priesthood, to offer spiritual sacrifices acceptable to God through Jesus Christ. But you are a chosen race, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a people for his own possession.

chaptersContent.title: Suffering for Christ
chaptersContent.summary: How to respond to suffering as a Christian
chaptersContent.content: Beloved, do not be surprised at the fiery trial when it comes upon you to test you, as though something strange were happening to you. But rejoice insofar as you share Christ's sufferings, that you may also rejoice and be glad when his glory is revealed.

books.name: 1 John
books.description: Fellowship with God through love and obedience
books.author: John

chaptersContent.title: Walking in the Light
chaptersContent.summary: Fellowship with God requires walking in the light
chaptersContent.content: This is the message we have heard from him and proclaim to you, that God is light, and in him is no darkness at all. But if we walk in the light, as he is in the light, we have fellowship with one another, and the blood of Jesus his Son cleanses us from all sin.

chaptersContent.title: God's Love and Our Love
chaptersContent.summary: Understanding and practicing God's love
chaptersContent.content: See what kind of love the Father has given to us, that we should be called children of God; and so we are. By this we know love, that he laid down his life for us, and we ought to lay down our lives for the brothers.

chaptersContent.title: God is Love
chaptersContent.summary: The nature and importance of love
chaptersContent.content: Anyone who does not love does not know God, because God is love. So we have come to know and to believe the love that God has for us. God is love, and whoever abides in love abides in God, and God abides in him.

chaptersContent.title: Assurance of Eternal Life
chaptersContent.summary: Confidence in eternal life through faith in Christ
chaptersContent.content: And this is the testimony, that God gave us eternal life, and this life is in his Son. I write these things to you who believe in the name of the Son of God, that you may know that you have eternal life.

books.name: 1 Thessalonians
books.description: Paul's encouragement and teaching about Christ's return
books.author: Paul

chaptersContent.title: The Rapture and Second Coming
chaptersContent.summary: Paul teaches about the rapture and resurrection of believers
chaptersContent.content: For the Lord himself will descend from heaven with a cry of command, with the voice of an archangel, and with the sound of the trumpet of God. And the dead in Christ will rise first. Then we who are alive, who are left, will be caught up together with them in the clouds to meet the Lord in the air.

chaptersContent.title: The Day of the Lord
chaptersContent.summary: Being ready for the Day of the Lord and Christian living
chaptersContent.content: For you yourselves are fully aware that the day of the Lord will come like a thief in the night. Pray without ceasing, give thanks in all circumstances; for this is the will of God in Christ Jesus for you.

books.name: Job
books.description: The story of Job's suffering and God's sovereignty
books.author: Unknown

chaptersContent.title: Job's Character and First Test
chaptersContent.summary: Job is introduced as a righteous man who faces Satan's first test
chaptersContent.content: There was a man in the land of Uz whose name was Job, and that man was blameless and upright, one who feared God and turned away from evil. And he said, 'Naked I came from my mother's womb, and naked shall I return. The Lord gave, and the Lord has taken away; blessed be the name of the Lord.'

chaptersContent.title: Job's Second Test
chaptersContent.summary: Satan afflicts Job with painful sores, but Job remains faithful
chaptersContent.content: And the Lord said to Satan, 'Have you considered my servant Job, that there is none like him on the earth, a blameless and upright man, who fears God and turns away from evil?' But he said to her, 'You speak as one of the foolish women would speak. Shall we receive good from God, and shall we not receive evil?'

chaptersContent.title: My Redeemer Lives
chaptersContent.summary: Job expresses faith that his Redeemer lives
chaptersContent.content: For I know that my Redeemer lives, and at the last he will stand upon the earth. And after my skin has been thus destroyed, yet in my flesh I shall see God, whom I shall see for myself, and my eyes shall behold, and not another.

chaptersContent.title: God Answers Job
chaptersContent.summary: God speaks to Job out of the whirlwind about His power and wisdom
chaptersContent.content: Then the Lord answered Job out of the whirlwind and said: 'Who is this that darkens counsel by words without knowledge? Where were you when I laid the foundation of the earth? Tell me, if you have understanding.'

chaptersContent.title: Job's Restoration
chaptersContent.summary: Job repents and God restores his fortunes double
chaptersContent.content: I know that you can do all things, and that no purpose of yours can be thwarted. I had heard of you by the hearing of the ear, but now my eye sees you; therefore I despise myself, and repent in dust and ashes.

books.name: Daniel
books.description: Daniel's faithfulness in exile and prophetic visions
books.author: Daniel

chaptersContent.title: Daniel's Resolve
chaptersContent.summary: Daniel and his friends remain faithful to God in Babylon
chaptersContent.content: But Daniel resolved that he would not defile himself with the king's food, or with the wine that he drank. Therefore he asked the chief of the eunuchs to allow him not to defile himself. As for these four youths, God gave them learning and skill in all literature and wisdom, and Daniel had understanding in all visions and dreams.

chaptersContent.title: The Fiery Furnace
chaptersContent.summary: Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego refuse to worship the golden image
chaptersContent.content: If this be so, our God whom we serve is able to deliver us from the burning fiery furnace, and he will deliver us out of your hand, O king. But if not, be it known to you, O king, that we will not serve your gods or worship the golden image that you have set up.

chaptersContent.title: Daniel in the Lion's Den
chaptersContent.summary: Daniel continues to pray despite the king's decree and is protected by God
chaptersContent.content: When Daniel knew that the document had been signed, he went to his house where he had windows in his upper chamber open toward Jerusalem. He got down on his knees three times a day and prayed and gave thanks before his God, as he had done previously.

chaptersContent.title: Daniel's Prayer and the Seventy Weeks
chaptersContent.summary: Daniel's prayer of confession and the prophecy of seventy weeks
chaptersContent.content: Then I turned my face to the Lord God, seeking him by prayer and pleas for mercy with fasting and sackcloth and ashes. O Lord, hear; O Lord, forgive. O Lord, pay attention and act. Delay not, for your own sake, O my God, because your city and your people are called by your name.

books.name: Joshua
books.description: The conquest of the Promised Land under Joshua's leadership
books.author: Unknown

chaptersContent.title: Joshua's Commission
chaptersContent.summary: God commissions Joshua to lead Israel into the Promised Land
chaptersContent.content: No man shall be able to stand before you all the days of your life. Just as I was with Moses, so I will be with you. I will not leave you or forsake you. This Book of the Law shall not depart from your mouth, but you shall meditate on it day and night.

chaptersContent.title: The Fall of Jericho
chaptersContent.summary: The walls of Jericho fall after Israel marches around the city
chaptersContent.content: And the Lord said to Joshua, 'See, I have given Jericho into your hand, with its king and mighty men of valor.' So the people shouted, and the trumpets were blown. As soon as the people heard the sound of the trumpet, the people shouted a great shout, and the wall fell down flat.

chaptersContent.title: The Covenant Renewed
chaptersContent.summary: Joshua challenges Israel to choose whom they will serve
chaptersContent.content: Now therefore fear the Lord and serve him in sincerity and in faithfulness. Put away the gods that your fathers served beyond the River and in Egypt, and serve the Lord. And if it is evil in your eyes to serve the Lord, choose this day whom you will serve. But as for me and my house, we will serve the Lord.

books.name: Judges
books.description: The period of judges and Israel's cycle of sin and deliverance
books.author: Unknown

chaptersContent.title: Gideon's Call
chaptersContent.summary: God calls Gideon to deliver Israel from the Midianites
chaptersContent.content: And the angel of the Lord appeared to him and said to him, 'The Lord is with you, O mighty man of valor.' And he said to him, 'Please, Lord, how can I save Israel? Behold, my clan is the weakest in Manasseh, and I am the least in my father's house.'

chaptersContent.title: Gideon's Victory
chaptersContent.summary: God gives victory through Gideon's small army of 300 men
chaptersContent.content: The Lord said to Gideon, 'The people with you are too many for me to give the Midianites into their hand, lest Israel boast over me, saying, "My own hand has saved me."' And the Lord said to Gideon, 'With the 300 men who lapped I will save you and give the Midianites into your hand.'

chaptersContent.title: Samson's Death
chaptersContent.summary: Samson's final act of strength destroys the Philistine temple
chaptersContent.content: Then Samson called to the Lord and said, 'O Lord God, please remember me and please strengthen me only this once, O God, that I may be avenged on the Philistines for my two eyes.' And Samson grasped the two middle pillars on which the house rested, and he leaned his weight against them.

books.name: 1 Samuel
books.description: The transition from judges to monarchy through Samuel, Saul, and David
books.author: Samuel and others

chaptersContent.title: Samuel's Call
chaptersContent.summary: Young Samuel hears God's voice and becomes a prophet
chaptersContent.content: Therefore Eli said to Samuel, 'Go, lie down, and if he calls you, you shall say, "Speak, Lord, for your servant hears."' So Samuel went and lay down in his place. And the Lord came and stood, calling as at other times, 'Samuel! Samuel!' And Samuel said, 'Speak, for your servant hears.'

chaptersContent.title: David and Goliath
chaptersContent.summary: Young David defeats the giant Goliath with faith in God
chaptersContent.content: Then David said to the Philistine, 'You come to me with a sword and with a spear and with a javelin, but I come to you in the name of the Lord of hosts, the God of the armies of Israel, whom you have defied. And that all this assembly may know that the Lord saves not with sword and spear. For the battle is the Lord's, and he will give you into our hand.'

chaptersContent.title: David Spares Saul
chaptersContent.summary: David shows mercy by sparing Saul's life in the cave
chaptersContent.content: He said to his men, 'The Lord forbid that I should do this thing to my lord, the Lord's anointed, to put out my hand against him, seeing he is the Lord's anointed.' Behold, this day your eyes have seen how the Lord gave you today into my hand in the cave. And some told me to kill you, but I spared you.

books.name: 2 Samuel
books.description: David's reign as king of Israel, his triumphs and failures
books.author: Unknown

chaptersContent.title: The Davidic Covenant
chaptersContent.summary: God promises David an eternal kingdom through his descendants
chaptersContent.content: When your days are fulfilled and you lie down with your fathers, I will raise up your offspring after you, who shall come from your body, and I will establish his kingdom. He shall build a house for my name, and I will establish the throne of his kingdom forever.

chaptersContent.title: David's Sin with Bathsheba
chaptersContent.summary: David commits adultery and arranges Uriah's death
chaptersContent.content: It happened, late one afternoon, when David arose from his couch and was walking on the roof of the king's house, that he saw from the roof a woman bathing; and the woman was very beautiful. So David sent messengers and took her, and she came to him, and he lay with her.

chaptersContent.title: Nathan's Rebuke and David's Repentance
chaptersContent.summary: Nathan confronts David about his sin, and David repents
chaptersContent.content: Nathan said to David, 'You are the man! Thus says the Lord, the God of Israel, "I anointed you king over Israel, and I delivered you out of the hand of Saul."' David said to Nathan, 'I have sinned against the Lord.' And Nathan said to David, 'The Lord also has put away your sin; you shall not die.'

books.name: 1 Kings
books.description: Solomon's reign and the beginning of the divided kingdom
books.author: Unknown

chaptersContent.title: Solomon's Wisdom
chaptersContent.summary: Solomon asks for wisdom and God grants his request
chaptersContent.content: Give your servant therefore an understanding mind to govern your people, that I may discern between good and evil, for who is able to govern this your great people? Behold, I now do according to your word. Behold, I give you a wise and discerning mind, so that none like you has been before you and none like you shall arise after you.

chaptersContent.title: Temple Dedication
chaptersContent.summary: Solomon dedicates the temple and God's glory fills it
chaptersContent.content: And when the priests came out of the Holy Place, a cloud filled the house of the Lord, so that the priests could not stand to minister because of the cloud, for the glory of the Lord filled the house of the Lord. But will God indeed dwell on the earth? Behold, heaven and the highest heaven cannot contain you; how much less this house that I have built!

chaptersContent.title: Elijah and the Prophets of Baal
chaptersContent.summary: Elijah defeats the prophets of Baal on Mount Carmel
chaptersContent.content: And Elijah came near to all the people and said, 'How long will you go limping between two different opinions? If the Lord is God, follow him; but if Baal, then follow him.' And the people did not answer him a word. Answer me, O Lord, answer me, that this people may know that you, O Lord, are God, and that you have turned their hearts back.

books.name: 2 Kings
books.description: The divided kingdom and eventual exile of both Israel and Judah
books.author: Unknown

chaptersContent.title: Elijah's Ascension
chaptersContent.summary: Elijah is taken up to heaven in a whirlwind, and Elisha receives his mantle
chaptersContent.content: When they had crossed, Elijah said to Elisha, 'Ask what I shall do for you, before I am taken from you.' And Elisha said, 'Please let there be a double portion of your spirit on me.' And as they still went on and talked, behold, chariots of fire and horses of fire separated the two of them. And Elijah went up by a whirlwind into heaven.

chaptersContent.title: Fall of Israel
chaptersContent.summary: The northern kingdom of Israel is conquered and exiled by Assyria
chaptersContent.content: In the ninth year of Hoshea, the king of Assyria captured Samaria, and he carried Israel away to Assyria and placed them in Halah, and on the Habor, the river of Gozan, and in the cities of the Medes. Yet the Lord warned Israel and Judah by every prophet and every seer, saying, 'Turn from your evil ways and keep my commandments.'

chaptersContent.title: Fall of Judah
chaptersContent.summary: Jerusalem is destroyed and Judah is exiled to Babylon
chaptersContent.content: And he burned the house of the Lord and the king's house and all the houses of Jerusalem; every great house he burned down. And Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carried into exile the rest of the people who were left in the city and the deserters who had deserted to the king of Babylon, together with the rest of the multitude.

books.name: Ezra
books.description: The return from Babylonian exile and rebuilding of the temple
books.author: Ezra

chaptersContent.title: Cyrus's Decree
chaptersContent.summary: King Cyrus allows the Jews to return and rebuild the temple
chaptersContent.content: In the first year of Cyrus king of Persia, that the word of the Lord by the mouth of Jeremiah might be fulfilled, the Lord stirred up the spirit of Cyrus king of Persia, so that he made a proclamation throughout all his kingdom and also put it in writing: 'Thus says Cyrus king of Persia: The Lord, the God of heaven, has given me all the kingdoms of the earth, and he has charged me to build him a house at Jerusalem, which is in Judah.'

chaptersContent.title: Temple Completion
chaptersContent.summary: The temple is completed and dedicated with great joy
chaptersContent.content: And the elders of the Jews built and prospered through the prophesying of Haggai the prophet and Zechariah the son of Iddo. They finished their building by decree of the God of Israel and by decree of Cyrus and Darius and Artaxerxes king of Persia. And the people of Israel, the priests and the Levites, and the rest of the returned exiles, celebrated the dedication of this house of God with joy.

chaptersContent.title: Ezra's Mission
chaptersContent.summary: Ezra comes to Jerusalem to teach the Law
chaptersContent.content: This Ezra went up from Babylonia. He was a scribe skilled in the Law of Moses that the Lord, the God of Israel, had given, and the king granted him all that he asked, for the hand of the Lord his God was on him. For Ezra had set his heart to study the Law of the Lord, and to do it and to teach his statutes and rules in Israel.

books.name: Nehemiah
books.description: Rebuilding Jerusalem's walls and spiritual renewal
books.author: Nehemiah

chaptersContent.title: Nehemiah's Prayer
chaptersContent.summary: Nehemiah prays for Jerusalem and seeks God's favor
chaptersContent.content: As soon as I heard these words I sat down and wept and mourned for days, and I continued fasting and praying before the God of heaven. Let your ear be attentive and your eyes open, to hear the prayer of your servant that I now pray before you day and night for the people of Israel your servants, confessing the sins of the people of Israel, which we have sinned against you.

chaptersContent.title: Reading the Law
chaptersContent.summary: Ezra reads the Law to the people and they understand
chaptersContent.content: And all the people gathered as one man into the square before the Water Gate. And they told Ezra the scribe to bring the Book of the Law of Moses that the Lord had commanded Israel. And Ezra blessed the Lord, the great God, and all the people answered, 'Amen, Amen,' lifting up their hands. And they bowed their heads and worshiped the Lord with their faces to the ground.

chaptersContent.title: National Confession
chaptersContent.summary: The people confess their sins and God's faithfulness
chaptersContent.content: And the Israelites separated themselves from all foreigners and stood and confessed their sins and the iniquities of their fathers. But you are a God ready to forgive, gracious and merciful, slow to anger and abounding in steadfast love, and did not forsake them.

books.name: Esther
books.description: God's providence in saving the Jewish people through Queen Esther
books.author: Unknown

chaptersContent.title: For Such a Time as This
chaptersContent.summary: Mordecai challenges Esther to act for her people's salvation
chaptersContent.content: Then Mordecai told them to reply to Esther, 'Do not think to yourself that in the king's palace you will escape any more than all the other Jews. For if you keep silent at this time, relief and deliverance will rise for the Jews from another place, but you and your father's house will perish. And who knows whether you have not come to the kingdom for such a time as this?'

chaptersContent.title: Haman's Downfall
chaptersContent.summary: Esther reveals Haman's plot and the king condemns him
chaptersContent.content: Then Queen Esther answered, 'If I have found favor in your sight, O king, and if it please the king, let my life be granted me for my petition, and my people for my request.' And Esther said, 'A foe and enemy! This wicked Haman!' Then Haman was terrified before the king and the queen.

chaptersContent.title: The Festival of Purim
chaptersContent.summary: The Jews are delivered and establish the festival of Purim
chaptersContent.content: Now in the twelfth month, which is the month of Adar, on the thirteenth day of the same, when the king's command and edict were about to be carried out, on the very day when the enemies of the Jews hoped to gain the mastery over them, the reverse occurred: the Jews gained mastery over those who hated them.

books.name: Colossians
books.description: Christ's supremacy and fullness in all things
books.author: Paul

chaptersContent.title: Christ Supreme
chaptersContent.summary: Christ is the image of God and supreme over all creation
chaptersContent.content: He is the image of the invisible God, the firstborn of all creation. For by him all things were created, in heaven and on earth, visible and invisible, whether thrones or dominions or rulers or authorities—all things were created through him and for him. And he is before all things, and in him all things hold together.

chaptersContent.title: Rooted in Christ
chaptersContent.summary: Believers are complete in Christ and rooted in Him
chaptersContent.content: Therefore, as you received Christ Jesus the Lord, so walk in him, rooted and built up in him and established in the faith, just as you were taught, abounding in thanksgiving. For in him the whole fullness of deity dwells bodily, and you have been filled in him, who is the head of all rule and authority.

chaptersContent.title: New Life in Christ
chaptersContent.summary: Instructions for the new life in Christ
chaptersContent.content: If then you have been raised with Christ, seek the things that are above, where Christ is, seated at the right hand of God. Put on then, as God's chosen ones, holy and beloved, compassionate hearts, kindness, humility, meekness, and patience. And whatever you do, in word or deed, do everything in the name of the Lord Jesus.

books.name: 2 Thessalonians
books.description: Clarification about the Day of the Lord and Christian living
books.author: Paul

chaptersContent.title: God's Righteous Judgment
chaptersContent.summary: God will repay persecution and give relief to the persecuted
chaptersContent.content: Therefore we ourselves boast about you in the churches of God for your steadfastness and faith in all your persecutions and in the afflictions that you are enduring. This is evidence of the righteous judgment of God, that you may be considered worthy of the kingdom of God, for which you are also suffering.

chaptersContent.title: The Man of Lawlessness
chaptersContent.summary: Paul clarifies signs that must precede the Day of the Lord
chaptersContent.content: Let no one deceive you in any way. For that day will not come, unless the rebellion comes first, and the man of lawlessness is revealed, the son of destruction. And then the lawless one will be revealed, whom the Lord Jesus will kill with the breath of his mouth and bring to nothing by the appearance of his coming.

chaptersContent.title: Work and Discipline
chaptersContent.summary: Paul commands believers to work and avoid idleness
chaptersContent.content: For even when we were with you, we would give you this command: If anyone is not willing to work, let him not eat. Now such persons we command and encourage in the Lord Jesus Christ to do their work quietly and to earn their own living.

books.name: 1 Timothy
books.description: Instructions for church leadership and sound doctrine
books.author: Paul

chaptersContent.title: Paul's Charge to Timothy
chaptersContent.summary: Paul charges Timothy to oppose false teaching and be faithful
chaptersContent.content: The aim of our charge is love that issues from a pure heart and a good conscience and a sincere faith. The saying is trustworthy and deserving of full acceptance, that Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners, of whom I am the foremost.

chaptersContent.title: Qualifications for Church Leaders
chaptersContent.summary: Requirements for overseers and deacons in the church
chaptersContent.content: The saying is trustworthy: If anyone aspires to the office of overseer, he desires a noble task. Therefore an overseer must be above reproach, the husband of one wife, sober-minded, self-controlled, respectable, hospitable, able to teach. If you delay, you may know how one ought to behave in the household of God, which is the church of the living God, a pillar and buttress of the truth.

chaptersContent.title: Godliness and Contentment
chaptersContent.summary: True godliness with contentment and warnings about money
chaptersContent.content: But godliness with contentment is great gain, for we brought nothing into the world, and we cannot take anything out of the world. For the love of money is a root of all kinds of evils. It is through this craving that some have wandered away from the faith and pierced themselves with many pangs.

books.name: 2 Timothy
books.description: Paul's final letter with encouragement to remain faithful
books.author: Paul

chaptersContent.title: A Good Soldier of Christ
chaptersContent.summary: Paul uses metaphors of soldier, athlete, and farmer for ministry
chaptersContent.content: Share in suffering as a good soldier of Christ Jesus. No soldier gets entangled in civilian pursuits, since his aim is to please the one who enlisted him. An athlete is not crowned unless he competes according to the rules. Do your best to present yourself to God as one approved, a worker who has no need to be ashamed, rightly handling the word of truth.

chaptersContent.title: Scripture and Last Days
chaptersContent.summary: The importance of Scripture and description of the last days
chaptersContent.content: Indeed, all who desire to live a godly life in Christ Jesus will be persecuted. All Scripture is breathed out by God and profitable for teaching, for reproof, for correction, and for training in righteousness, that the man of God may be complete, equipped for every good work.

chaptersContent.title: Paul's Final Charge
chaptersContent.summary: Paul's final instructions and personal reflections
chaptersContent.content: Preach the word; be ready in season and out of season; reprove, rebuke, and exhort, with complete patience and teaching. I have fought the good fight, I have finished the race, I have kept the faith. Henceforth there is laid up for me the crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous judge, will award to me on that Day, and not only to me but also to all who have loved his appearing.

books.name: Titus
books.description: Instructions for church organization and Christian living
books.author: Paul

chaptersContent.title: Appointing Elders
chaptersContent.summary: Qualifications for elders and dealing with false teachers
chaptersContent.content: This is why I left you in Crete, so that you might put what remained into order, and appoint elders in every town as I directed you. He must hold firm to the trustworthy word as taught, so that he may be able to give instruction in sound doctrine and also to rebuke those who contradict it.

chaptersContent.title: Sound Doctrine and Good Works
chaptersContent.summary: Instructions for different groups in the church
chaptersContent.content: For the grace of God has appeared, bringing salvation for all people, training us to renounce ungodliness and worldly passions, and to live self-controlled, upright, and godly lives in the present age. Who gave himself for us to redeem us from all lawlessness and to purify for himself a people for his own possession who are zealous for good works.

chaptersContent.title: Salvation and Good Works
chaptersContent.summary: Salvation by grace and the importance of good works
chaptersContent.content: He saved us, not because of works done by us in righteousness, but according to his own mercy, by the washing of regeneration and renewal of the Holy Spirit. The saying is trustworthy, and I want you to insist on these things, so that those who have believed in God may be careful to devote themselves to good works.

books.name: 2 Peter
books.description: Warning against false teachers and the Day of the Lord
books.author: Peter

chaptersContent.title: Growing in Knowledge
chaptersContent.summary: Peter encourages growth in Christian virtues and knowledge
chaptersContent.content: His divine power has granted to us all things that pertain to life and godliness, through the knowledge of him who called us to his own glory and excellence. For if these qualities are yours and are increasing, they keep you from being ineffective or unfruitful in the knowledge of our Lord Jesus Christ.

chaptersContent.title: False Teachers
chaptersContent.summary: Warning about false teachers and their destruction
chaptersContent.content: But false prophets also arose among the people, just as there will be false teachers among you, who will secretly bring in destructive heresies, even denying the Master who bought them, bringing upon themselves swift destruction. Then the Lord knows how to rescue the godly from trials, and to keep the unrighteous under punishment until the day of judgment.

chaptersContent.title: The Day of the Lord
chaptersContent.summary: The promise of Christ's return and new heavens and earth
chaptersContent.content: The Lord is not slow to fulfill his promise as some count slowness, but is patient toward you, not wishing that any should perish, but that all should reach repentance. But the day of the Lord will come like a thief, and then the heavens will pass away with a roar, and the heavenly bodies will be burned up and dissolved, and the earth and the works that are done on it will be exposed.
